item.title: 备忘录显示巴辛退休，美国银行任命新技术主管
item.description: 根据路透社周一看到的一份内部备忘录，美国银行首席技术与信息官阿迪亚-巴辛（Aditya Bhasin）将从该银行退休，由哈里-戈帕克里什南（Hari Gopalkrishnan）接任。【原文：Bank of America's chief technology and information officer, Aditya Bhasin, is retiring from the lender and will be replaced by Hari Gopalkrishnan, according to an internal memo seen by Reuters on Monday.】

item.title: 欧盟每年为美国能源支出 2500 亿美元不切实际
item.description: 欧盟承诺每年购买 2,500 亿美元的美国能源供应是不现实的，因为这需要美国将大部分能源出口转向欧洲，而欧盟对其公司进口的能源几乎没有控制权。【原文：The European Union's pledge to buy $250 billion of U.S. energy supplies per year is unrealistic because it would require the redirection of most U.S. energy exports towards Europe and the EU has little control over the energy its companies import.】

item.title: 保费和利息收入增加，辛辛那提金融公司季度利润翻了一番多
item.description: 财产保险公司辛辛那提金融公司（Cincinnati Financial）周一报告称，由于保费和投资收益增加，该公司第二季度利润增长了一倍多。【原文：Property and casualty insurer Cincinnati Financial reported on Monday that its second-quarter profit more than doubled, reflecting higher premiums and investment income.】

item.title: 芯片设计软件供应商 Cadence 上调年度销售额预期
item.description: 本月早些时候，美国取消了对中国的芯片设计软件出口限制，使该公司得以恢复对中国这一重要市场的销售，因此，Cadence Design Systems 公司周一上调了今年的销售预期。【原文：Cadence Design Systems raised its sales forecast for the year on Monday, after the U.S. lifted export curbs on chip design software to China earlier this month, allowing the company to resume sales to the key market.】

item.title: 独家报道消息人士称，Cadence接近达成向美国支付超过1亿美元的中国销售额的协议
item.description: 据两位熟悉内情的人士透露，Cadence Design 公司预计将向美国政府支付超过 1 亿美元，作为解决其芯片设计产品销售给中国一所军事大学调查的一部分。【原文：Cadence Design is expected to pay over $100 million to the U.S. government as part of a deal to resolve an investigation into sales of its chip design products to a Chinese military university believed to be involved in simulating nuclear explosions, according to two people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 消息人士称，规模 AI 竞争对手 Micro1 正在以 5 亿美元的估值筹集资金
item.description: 据两位熟悉内情的消息人士透露，规模 AI 竞争对手 Micro1 正在敲定 A 轮融资，估值 5 亿美元。【原文：Scale AI competitor Micro1 is finalizing a Series A round valuing the startup at $500 million, according to two sources familiar with the matter.】

item.title: Venture Global 批准建设 CP2 液化天然气项目，股价上涨 5
item.description: 美国液化天然气公司 Venture Global 周一表示，在完成了该项目一期工程 151 亿美元的融资后，公司已决定继续在路易斯安那州建造 CP2 出口设施。【原文：U.S. liquefied natural gas company Venture Global said on Monday it has decided to go ahead with the construction of its CP2 export facility in Louisiana after it closed $15.1 billion in financing for the first phase of the project.】

item.title: 精神航空公司将裁员 270 名飞行员，另有 140 名飞行员因缩减计划而降级
item.description: 精神航空公司（Spirit Airlines）周一表示，该公司将裁减约 270 名飞行员，同时将另外 140 名飞行员降级，因为这家资金短缺的廉价航空公司希望缩减员工人数，以配合缩减后的时间表。【原文：Spirit Airlines said on Monday it will furlough about 270 pilots while demoting another 140, as the cash-strapped budget carrier looks to scale down its workforce to match a downsized schedule.】

item.title: 法国出口商称，欧盟-美国贸易协议有望确认烈酒免税贸易
item.description: 法国葡萄酒和烈酒出口商联合会（FEVS）周一表示，欧盟与美国达成的贸易协议有望确认烈酒免税贸易。【原文：The French wine and spirits exporters' federation FEVS said on Monday the trade deal struck between the European Union and the United States was expected to confirm duty-free trade in spirits.】

item.title: 分析师称，欧盟与美国的贸易协议可能使制药业成本增加高达 190 亿美元
item.description: 分析师周一表示，欧盟与美国达成的贸易协议可能使制药业损失 130 亿至 190 亿美元，因为品牌药品将被征收 15%的关税。【原文：The European Union's trade deal with the United States could cost the pharmaceutical industry between $13 billion and $19 billion as branded medicines become subject to a tariff of 15%, analysts said on Monday.】

item.title: 德国默茨称未预期欧盟与美国达成更好的贸易协议，德国经济将受影响
item.description: 德国总理弗里德里希-梅尔茨（Friedrich Merz）周一表示，他对与美国的贸易谈判结果并不满意，但 "更多的成果根本无法实现"，并补充说，德国经济将因商定的关税而遭受 "重大 "损害。【原文：German Chancellor Friedrich Merz said on Monday he was not satisfied with the result of trade talks with the United States, but "more simply wasn't achievable" and added the German economy would suffer "significant" damage due to the agreed tariffs.】

item.title: 间谍卫星机构称执法部门正在调查影响承包网站的 "事件
item.description: 美国间谍卫星机构周一表示，当局正在调查一起影响到一个为未来情报界承包商服务的网站的不明事件。【原文：The U.S. spy satellite agency said on Monday authorities are investigating an unspecified incident affecting a website serving prospective intelligence community contractors.】

item.title: 微软在 Edge 浏览器中推出基于人工智能的 Copilot 模式
item.description: 微软公司周一在其 Edge 浏览器上推出了一种新的 "Copilot 模式"，利用人工智能改善浏览体验。【原文：Microsoft on Monday launched a new "Copilot Mode" on its Edge browser that uses artificial intelligence to improve the browsing experience, as the tech giant rushes to compete with rivals launching AI-based browsers and web search features.】

item.title: 特朗普希望对大多数国家征收 15-20% 的 "世界关税
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普周一表示，大多数贸易伙伴如果不就单独的贸易协议进行谈判，将很快面临对其出口到美国的商品征收15%至20%的关税，远高于他在4月份广泛征收的10%关税。【原文：President Donald Trump said on Monday most trading partners that do not negotiate separate trade deals would soon face tariffs of 15% to 20% on their exports to the United States, well above the broad 10% tariff he imposed in April.】

item.title: 意大利瓦尔波里切拉地区的葡萄酒生产商为美国关税做好准备
item.description: 在周日达成的美国-欧盟贸易协议中，葡萄酒和烈酒被排除在外，意大利的葡萄酒生产商本已在经济放缓和欧元升值的双重压力下举步维艰，现在又面临着新的挑战。【原文：Italy's wine producers, already struggling amid a slowing economy and a strengthening euro, face a further challenge after wine and spirits were left out of the U.S.-EU trade deal agreed on Sunday.】

item.title: 美欧航空业竞争对手如何联合起来维护免关税飞机贸易
item.description: 美国和欧盟达成飞机免征关税的临时协议，避免了对两地喷气机生产和交付的潜在威胁，同时也结束了几个月来飞机制造竞争对手之间一反常态的团结。【原文：A provisional deal between the United States and European Union to exempt aircraft from tariffs avoids a potential threat to jet production and deliveries in both regions and caps months of uncharacteristic unity among plane-making rivals.】

item.title: 华纳兄弟探索公司宣布分拆后新公司的名称
item.description: 华纳兄弟探索公司（Warner Bros Discovery）周一表示，当公司在 2026 年中期一分为二时，旗下的电影工作室、HBO 流媒体服务和游戏工作室将被称为 "华纳兄弟"（Warner Bros）。该公司表示，其另一个部门 "全球网络 "将包括娱乐、体育和新闻电视品牌，包括 CNN、TNT 体育和 Discovery+ 流媒体服务，该部门将被称为 "Discovery Global"。【原文：Warner Bros Discovery said on Monday its division that houses its film studios, HBO streaming services and gaming studios would be called "Warner Bros" when the company splits into two in mid-2026. Its other division, "Global Networks", which will include entertainment, sports and news television brands including CNN, TNT Sports and the Discovery+ streaming service will be called "Discovery Global", the company said.】

item.title: 智利将要求美国将铜纳入美智贸易协定
item.description: 智利财政部长马里奥-马塞尔（Mario Marcel）周一在接受当地电台节目Duna采访时表示，智利预计本周在华盛顿举行的更广泛的美国贸易谈判中将讨论美国铜关税问题。【原文：Chile expects U.S. copper tariffs to be discussed within broader U.S. trade talks in Washington this week, Finance Minister Mario Marcel said on Monday in an interview with local radio program Duna.】

item.title: Canalys 称：印度手机激增，美国智能手机市场增长乏力
item.description: 研究公司Canalys周一称，由于供应商在关税担忧下提前加载设备库存，美国智能手机市场第二季度仅增长1%，而中美之间的供应链谈判促进了印度产手机的出货量。【原文：The United States smartphone market grew just 1% in the second quarter as vendors front-loaded device inventories amid tariff concerns, while supply chain negotiations between China and the United States boosted shipments of Indian-made phones, research firm Canalys said on Monday.】

item.title: 依视路上半年营业利润增长 4.1
item.description: 意大利依视路光学集团（EssilorLuxottica）周一表示，由于要应对美国关税的影响，该公司今年上半年的营业利润增幅略低于预期的 4.1%。【原文：Operating profit at EssilorLuxottica rose a slightly smaller-than-expected 4.1% in the first half of the year, the Franco-Italian eyewear and optical lenses group said on Monday, as it dealt with the impact of U.S. tariffs.】

item.title: 加拿大道明银行任命新行长领导监督工作
item.description: 道明银行已任命独立董事约翰-麦金太尔（John MacIntyre）为新任董事会主席，这家加拿大贷款机构将启用新的后卫来加强监管并让投资者放心。【原文：TD Bank has named independent director John MacIntyre as the new chair of its board, as the Canadian lender turns to a new guard to bolster oversight and reassure investors.】

item.title: 墨西哥国家石油公司第二季度实现净利润
item.description: 墨西哥国家能源公司 Pemex 周一报告称，该公司第二季度净利润从去年同期的 2,733.3 亿比索（31.7 亿美元）转为 595.2 亿比索（31.7 亿美元）。【原文：Mexico's state energy company Pemex on Monday reported a swing to net profit in the second quarter, reaching 59.52 billion pesos ($3.17 billion), from a net loss of 273.33 billion pesos in the same quarter last year.】

item.title: 消费趋势稳健，维萨卡和万事达卡利润增加
item.description: 威士卡和万事达卡预计将在本周公布因消费者支出稳定而增加的季度利润，分析师们将仔细研究在关税不确定的情况下，旅游和自由支配消费的需求是如何形成的。【原文：Visa and Mastercard are expected to report higher quarterly profits this week on steady consumer spending, and analysts will scrutinize how demand for travel and discretionary purchases is shaping up in the face of tariff uncertainty.】

item.title: Figma 在美国首次公开募股的目标估值为 188 亿美元，此前上调了价格区间
item.description: Figma 周一上调了其美国首次公开募股的拟议价格区间，目前的目标估值为 188 亿美元，这是投资者对高增长科技股青睐有加的最新迹象。【原文：Figma raised the proposed price range for its U.S. initial public offering on Monday and is now aiming for a valuation of $18.8 billion, in the latest sign of strong investor appetite for high-growth technology stocks.】

item.title: 斯塔默：英国和美国应合作开发小型模块化反应堆
item.description: 英国首相基尔-斯塔姆（Keir Starmer）周一在苏格兰的高尔夫度假村会见美国总统唐纳德-特朗普时表示，英国将受益于与美国在小型模块化反应堆（SMR）方面更紧密的合作。【原文：British Prime Minister Keir Starmer said the country would benefit from working more closely with the United States on small modular reactors (SMRs) as he met U.S. President Donald Trump at his golf resort in Scotland on Monday.】

item.title: 股价下滑，欧洲汽车制造商接受特朗普的现实检验
item.description: 欧洲的汽车制造商已经在与来自亚洲的激烈竞争和代价高昂的电动汽车转型作斗争，周一又要面对另一个现实--美国总统唐纳德-特朗普征收关税。【原文：Europe's carmakers, already battling stiff competition from Asia and a costly transition to electric cars, were dealing with another dose of reality on Monday - tariffs imposed by U.S. President Donald Trump.】

item.title: 欧盟和美国将组建金属联盟制衡中国产能过剩
item.description: 欧盟贸易委员马罗斯-塞夫科维奇（Maros Sefcovic）周一表示，作为贸易协议的一部分，欧盟和美国将建立金属联盟，以减轻中国补贴生产对全球市场的影响。【原文：The European Union and United States will develop a metals alliance to mitigate the impact of subsidised Chinese production on global markets as part of their trade deal, European Trade Commissioner Maros Sefcovic said on Monday.】

item.title: 巴西咖啡种植者对特朗普即将征收的关税保持警惕
item.description: 巴西里约热内卢州瓦苏拉斯的咖啡种植者希望在巴西对美国出口征收 50%的关税之前，能在最后一刻获得缓和。【原文：Coffee growers in Vassouras, in Brazil's Rio de Janeiro state, are hoping for an eleventh-hour reprieve before the country is subject to tariffs of 50% on its exports to the United States.】

item.title: 金价将保持在 3000 美元/盎司以上，因为避险情绪仍在持续：路透社民意调查
item.description: 对全球贸易和财政债务的担忧导致人们纷纷转向更安全的资产，使黄金作为避险天堂的优势更加突出，促使路透社民意调查的分析师大幅提高了他们的预测。【原文：Global trade and fiscal debt concerns are feeding into a flight to safer assets, sharpening gold's edge as a haven from risk, prompting analysts in a Reuters poll to sharply raise their forecasts.】

item.title: 随着赫姆斯利成为焦点，联合健康的投资者可能会寻求成本路线图
item.description: 联合健康（UnitedHealth）新任首席执行官斯蒂芬-赫姆斯利（Stephen Hemsley）可能将面临投资者的审查，因为这家美国最大的健康保险和服务公司正在努力控制医疗成本的上升，而这正是其撤回年度预测的原因。【原文：UnitedHealth's newly returned CEO, Stephen Hemsley, will likely face investor scrutiny over the largest U.S. health insurance and services company's efforts to rein in the elevated medical costs behind the withdrawal of its annual forecast.】
